marketNews.title: IHSG Rises -1.39%, ADRO Distributes Interim Dividends with Indicated Yield of 4.2%
marketNews.content: IHSG fell -1.39%, ADRO Distributes Interim Dividends with Indicated Yield of 4.2%. Compilation of news for today. 17 December 2024

marketNews.title: World Bank Maintains Indonesia's Economic Growth Outlook at +5% for 2024 and +5.1% for 2025 and 2026
marketNews.content: The World Bank maintained the outlook for Indonesia's economic growth at the level of +5% in 2024 and +5.1% in 2025 and 2026. Nevertheless, the World Bank projects Indonesia's economy will slow down to +5% in 2027. This outlook is far below President Prabowo Subianto's target which aims for economic growth of +8% within 3 years after he takes office.

marketNews.title: China Plans Record Budget Deficit of 4% of GDP for 2025, Say Sources
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Chinese government plans to set an economic growth target of around +5% for 2025 (vs. 2024 target: +5%), with the budget deficit rising from the 3% level to 4% of GDP. The Reuters report emerged a few days after leaders in China - including President Xi Jinping - concluded the annual economic conference in Beijing, where they are expected to have set targets for 2025. The official announcement of the economic targets will only be made officially at the parliamentary session in March 2025. Bloomberg reported that both targets are largely in line with economists' expectations.

marketNews.title: KPK Searches Bank Indonesia Office Regarding CSR Fund Corruption Case
marketNews.content: CNN Indonesia reported that the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) on Monday night (16/12) searched the Bank Indonesia office - including the office of the Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo - regarding a case of alleged corruption in corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds. Previously, the KPK in September 2024 disclosed alleged misuse of Bank Indonesia's CSR funds for personal interests. This search occurred just one day before the Bank Indonesia Governor Meeting scheduled for 17-18 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: RATU, Subsidiary of RAJA, Plans IPO with Market Cap of Rp2.4-3.1 T
tickerNews.content: RATU: Subsidiary of RAJA, IPO with Market Cap Rp2.4-3.1 T. The subsidiary of Rukun Raharja (RAJA), Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU), announced a plan for an IPO by offering 543.01 million shares (20%), consisting of 190 million (7%) new shares and 352.9 million (13%) divested shares from RAJA's ownership. The offering price range is between 900-1,150 rupiah per share, implying a market cap of around 2.4-3.1 trillion rupiah. Total proceeds from this IPO range from 488.7-624.5 billion rupiah, where approximately 171-218.6 billion rupiah will go to RATU's cash while approximately 317.7-405.9 billion rupiah will go to RAJA's cash. RATU is a holding company that invests as a non-operator in 2 oil and gas exploration blocks in Indonesia, namely the Cepu Block (participation rights ~2.2%) and the Jabung Block (participation rights 8%). During 1H24, the Cepu Block produced 144 MBOPD of oil, equivalent to ~25% of total national oil lifting as of 1H24. Meanwhile, the Jabung Block produced 52 MBOEPD of oil and gas, equivalent to ~3.5% of total national oil and gas lifting as of 1H24. Structure of Shareholders: After the IPO, RATU's shareholders consist of RAJA (~80%), PT Rukun Prima Sarana (0.004%), and the public (20%). Use of IPO Funds: All IPO funds will be allocated for working capital, namely: Approximately 157.36 billion rupiah will be loaned to PT Raharja Energi Tanjung Jabung to pay the cash call from PetroChina International Jabung Ltd. related to the management of the Jabung Block. Approximately 34.97 billion rupiah will be loaned to PT Petrogas Jatim Utama Cendana to pay the cash call from ExxonMobil Cepu Ltd. related to the management of the Cepu Block. The remaining funds will be used for remuneration of employees, directors, commissioners, and operational costs. Valuation: RATU is offered at a valuation of approximately 6.0-7.6x Trailing Twelve Months (TTM) P/E based on 1H24. On an annualized 1H24 basis, RATU is offered at a valuation of approximately 10.3-13.2x P/E, lower than the valuation of RAJA which traded at 22.9x annualized 1H24 P/E as of Tuesday (17/12) at a level of 2,670 rupiah per share. Nevertheless, RATU's valuation is considered premium compared to its peers such as Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) and Energi Mega Persada (ENRG) which traded at 4.5x and 4.9x annualized 9M24 P/E respectively as of Tuesday (17/12). Details of the valuation comparison of RATU with its peers can be seen in the table below: Key Takeaway: Although RATU's valuation is higher compared to its peers like MEDC and ENRG, at first glance we assess that RATU deserves a premium trading due to its superior profitability compared to its peers, as seen from its much higher ROE and ROA.

tickerNews.title: ADRO to Distribute Interim Dividend with Indicated Yield of 4.2%
tickerNews.content: ADRO: Alamtri Resources Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 200 million US dollars or 105 rupiah per share, assuming the exchange rate of Rupiah against the US Dollar at the level of 16,146. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 27, 2024, with payment on January 15, 2025. Referring to ADRO's stock price at the close of the market on Tuesday (17/12) at 2,510 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 4.2%.

tickerNews.title: Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. Increases Ownership in SILO to 63.4% after Acquiring Shares from Prime Health Company Limited
tickerNews.content: SILO: The controller of Siloam International Hospitals, Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd., purchased 1.05 billion SILO shares from Prime Health Company Limited at an average price of 2,850 rupiah per share on December 11, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~3 trillion rupiah. After this transaction, Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in SILO increased from 55.4% to 63.4%, while Prime Health Company Limited's ownership in SILO decreased from 8.04% to none.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Shareholders Approve 1:10 Stock Split Plan
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea shareholders on Monday (16/12) approved the stock split plan with a ratio of 1:10. Based on previous information disclosure, the trading schedule for shares with the new nominal value in the regular and negotiation market is on December 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: ACES Closed 7 Stores in 2024 but Opened 19 New Stores, Exceeding 2024 Target
tickerNews.content: ACES: Head of Corporate Communications Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia, Melinda Pudjo, said that the company has closed 7 stores since the beginning of 2024, while the total number of new stores opened reached 19 stores. The number of new stores has exceeded the 2024 target of 15 new stores, and it indicates that the total number of ACES stores currently reaches 245 stores (vs. 2023: 233 stores). Melinda stated that the store expansion plan in 2025 will be designed to continue the momentum of the company's performance growth during 2024, although she did not detail the new store opening targets or CAPEX allocation for next year.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Grew +3.7% YoY in November 2024, Market Share Rose to 29.5%
tickerNews.content: INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded cement sales volume growth (including Semen Grobogan) of +3.7% Year-over-Year (YoY) in November 2024, with market share rising to the level of 29.5% (vs. November 2023: 27.3%) due to the industry's total sales volume declining -4% YoY. INTP's sales volume growth in November 2024 was supported by Java Island (+7.2% YoY), with the Central Java region showing significant growth (+49% YoY) due to the consolidation of Semen Grobogan. During 11M24, INTP's cement sales volume grew +9% YoY to 17.3 million tons.

tickerNews.title: LINK Targets Addition of 1-1.5 Million Homepasses in 2025
tickerNews.content: LINK: Link Net Director, Kanishka Gayan Wickrama, stated that the company targets the addition of approximately 1-1.5 million homepasses in 2025. Kanishka mentioned that LINK is currently finalizing its business plan, so details regarding performance targets and CAPEX allocation for 2025 cannot yet be provided. During 9M24, LINK recorded an addition of 482,000 homepass networks, reaching 4.03 million.

tickerNews.title: RDTX to Distribute Interim Dividend of ~Rp40.6 Billion for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: RDTX: Roda Vivatex will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~40.6 billion rupiah or 151 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 27, 2024, with payment on January 15, 2025. Referring to RDTX's stock price at the close of the market on Tuesday (17/12) at 15,000 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 1%.

tickerNews.title: Bloomberg Reports Pan Brothers (PBRX) Nearing Completion of $537 Million Debt Restructuring
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Pan Brothers (PBRX) is close to completing its 537 million US dollar debt restructuring after 7 months of negotiations with creditors. PBRX will seek restructuring approval from creditors on Wednesday (18/12), where this approval will prevent the company from bankruptcy. Bloomberg sources said that major creditors - including SC Lowy - have given verbal support regarding the restructuring plan. PBRX is one of the largest textile companies in Indonesia, with approximately 27,000 employees.

tickerNews.title: AMAR to Distribute Interim Dividend of ~Rp25.2 Billion for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Bank Amar Indonesia (AMAR) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~25.2 billion rupiah or 1.4 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 24, 2024, with payment on January 15, 2025. Referring to AMAR's stock price at the close of the market on Tuesday (17/12) at 199 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 0.7%.

tickerNews.title: Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund Increases Stake in PZZA to 6.29%
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Sarimelati Kencana (PZZA), Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund, purchased 40 million PZZA shares at a price of 128 rupiah per share on December 12, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~5.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund's ownership in PZZA increased from 4.96% to 6.29%.

tickerNews.title: Jon Fieris Reduces Ownership in FITT from 14.72% to 9.35% After Selling 70 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Hotel Fitra International (FITT), Jon Fieris, sold 70 million FITT shares at an average price of 96 rupiah per share on December 12-13, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~6.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Jon Fieris's ownership in FITT decreased from 14.72% to 9.35%.
